summary: The Internal Revenue Service Math and Taxpayer Help Act of 2025 (IRS MATH Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to improve notices of math or clerical errors by the IRS. The bill requires more detailed and specific notices, including an itemized computation of adjustments and a deadline for requesting abatement. It also mandates a pilot program to test sending notices via certified mail and a report to Congress on its effectiveness. Furthermore, the bill outlines procedures for taxpayers to request abatement and specifies the effective date of the amendments.
